title: Performance Influencing Factors
content: PIFs are conditions that affect human reliability: competence, time pressure, fatigue, procedure quality, equipment design, and organizational culture. Identifying and optimizing PIFs reduces error likelihood. Poor PIFs make even skilled operators unreliable. Good PIFs enable consistent performance.

mcq.question: A well control procedure is rarely used. The driller is fatigued after 11 hours on shift. The BOP panel has inconsistent labeling. How many negative PIFs exist?

options.A: One—fatigue is the only real issue
options.C: Three—infrequent task, fatigue, and poor HMI design

mcq.explanation: All three are PIFs: task infrequency (lack of practice), fatigue (reduced cognitive performance), and poor labeling (increased error likelihood). They compound risk.

openQuestions: What PIFs most frequently degrade performance on your rig?
How does your organization assess and improve PIFs for safety-critical tasks?
